stem: For upper‑limb imaging, which modality generally offers the best soft‑tissue contrast (muscles, tendons, ligaments)?
rationale_correct: MRI provides excellent soft‑tissue contrast for the upper limb.

rationale_distractors.A: Radiographs are best for gross osseous evaluation and alignment.
rationale_distractors.B: CT excels at cortical bone detail; soft‑tissue contrast is less than MRI.
rationale_distractors.D: US is useful and dynamic but contrast depends on operator and target depth.
rationale_distractors.E: Fluoroscopy is real‑time X‑ray used for procedures, not cross‑sectional contrast.

evidence.citation: Rhodes D. Learning objectives for Radiology of the Upper Limb. 2018/2021.
